remarks: The predicate "is an atomic lattice."  Every nonzero element is less than or equal to an atom.  (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2011.)  (Revised by NM, 14-Sep-2018.)
statement:
isatlat.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
isatlat.g $e |- G = ( glb ` K ) $.
isatlat.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
isatlat.z $e |- .0. = ( 0. ` K ) $.
isatlat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
isatl $p |- ( K e. AtLat <-> ( K e. Lat /\ B e. dom G /\ A. x e. B ( x =/= .0. -> E. y e. A y .<_ x ) ) ) $.
$d A y $.
$d B x $.
$d K x y $.
